intro: Anoplophytum luteum, commonly known as the yellow sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to hot, dry climates. Its structure includes a low-growing, spreading habit with branched stems and small, alternate leaves. Anoplophytum luteum is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
